thread.title: Ryan Giggs defends "not brilliant but not bad" Paul Pogba and says critics should cut Man United star some slack
thread.title_full: Ryan Giggs defends "not brilliant but not bad" Paul Pogba and says critics should cut Man United star some slack

author: Jim Daly
title: Ryan Giggs defends "not brilliant but not bad" Paul Pogba and says critics should cut Man United star some slack
text:
Ryan Giggs defends "not brilliant but not bad" Paul Pogba and says critics should cut Man United star some slack "He will become a brilliant midfielder; there is no doubt in that" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Ryan Giggs sticks up for Paul Pogba Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United legend Ryan Giggs has come out in defence of £89.3 signing Paul Pogba . 
But he has failed to set the Premier League alight in the way many Red Devils fans would have hoped. 
And Giggs, who played more than 900 times for the club, won countless trophies and was caretaker manager for a short spell, believes the French playmaker will come good. 
"I have never seen a 23-year-old midfield player dominate games for a whole season," he said. 
"So, the £90 million that they paid is what obviously people focus on and what people talk about. It's not going Pogba's way this season? (Photo: REUTERS) 
"He will become a brilliant midfielder; there is no doubt in that. 
"I think he scored seven or eight goals, again, not many midfielders at 23 will do that... but because he cost so much, he is compared with that price tag when actually, he has done okay this season. 
"Okay, not brilliant but not really bad. So yeah, I think a lot people should cut him a bit of slack." poll loading Is Paul Pogba worth £89million? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
